alert.note: Alert for Northern Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 21 at 3:13PM PST until December 22 at 8:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...MORE SNOW ON THE WAY FOR THE CASCADES TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY... .Another storm system will take aim at the Cascades of Oregon and southwest Washington beginning overnight tonight and persisting through most of Wednesday. Heavy snow is expected at elevations above 3000 to 4000 feet. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 8 AM PST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM WEDNESDAY TO 4 PM PST THURSDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow developing overnight tonight above 4000 feet, with heavy snow expected Wednesday into Thursday. Total snow accumulations between 16 and 28 inches are expected by Thursday. Winds gusts as high as 35 mph will also result in blowing and drifting snow, and reduced visibility. * WHERE...Northern Oregon Cascades. * WHEN...Winter Weather Advisory from 8 PM this evening to 8 AM Wednesday, then a Winter Storm Warning from 8 AM Wednesday to 4 PM Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel conditions are expected to be difficult. Expect snow and ice covered roads and greatly reduced visibility.
info.instruction: Be prepared for winter driving conditions with snow and ice covered roads and very limited visibility. If you must travel in the mountains, slow down, and allow plenty of extra time to reach your destination. Allow extra following distance to the vehicle in front of you, and keep snow chains and a winter survival kit, including a flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions visit https://www.tripcheck.com or https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map or by calling 5 1 1
